main event: Aerial phenomena resembling jet exhaust lights were observed on multiple occasions near Cornell University in Ithaca, New York in December 1952 and February 1952.
interesting points: The observed light on December 17, 1952 was greenish-blue with an orange trail and moved at an estimated speed exceeding 700 mph., The observation on February 9, 1952 described a yellowish-white light with a green tinge that also moved at a high speed., Observers estimated the altitude of the lights to be around 20,000 feet., The lights disappeared quickly, with no visible structure, behind high cirrus clouds., Local civil defense authorities were notified after the sightings.
witness description: Observers from the campus of Cornell University
